intro: Blepharis uzondoensis, commonly known as the Uzondo grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it blooms during the rainy season. Blepharis uzondoensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability.
